paper_title.en: On Doob's inequality and Burkholder's inequality in weak spaces
paper_title.ja: On Doob’s inequality and Burkholder’s inequality in weak spaces

description.en: Let X be aBanach function space over a nonatomic probability space. We associate with X the weak space w-X, which is a quasi-Banach space defined in a natural way. We give necessary and sufficient conditions for Doob's inequality in w-X to be valid, and necessary and sufficient conditions for Burkholder's inequality in w-X to be valid.

paper_title.en: A RELATION BETWEEN TWO KINDS OF NORMS FOR MARTINGALES

description.en: Let X be a Banach function space over a nonatomic probability space Omega and let M-u denote the collection of all uniformly integrable martingales on Omega. For f = (f(n)) n is an element of Z(+) is an element of M-u, let M-f denote the maximal function of f, and let f(infinity) denote the almost sure limit of f. We give some necessary and sufficient conditions for X to have the property that if f, g is an element of M-u and parallel to M-g parallel to(X) <= parallel to Mf parallel to(X), then parallel to g infinity parallel to(X) <= C parallel to f infinity parallel to(X). (C) 2015 Mathematical Institute Slovak Academy of Sciences

paper_title.en: On some martingale inequalities for mean oscillations in weak spaces

description.en: Given a Banach function space X over a nonatomic probability space, we define, in a natural way, a quasi-Banach function space which is denoted by w-X. In this paper, we consider some inequalities in w-X involving the mean oscillation and the maximal function of a martingale. The main results give necessary and sufficient conditions for the inequalities to be valid.

paper_title.ja: マルチンゲールと関数空間
paper_title.en: Martingales and function spaces

publisher.ja: 一般社団法人 日本数学会

paper_title.en: On some inequalities for martingale transforms in banach function spaces

description.en: Let X be a Banach function space over a probability space. We consider the inequality (vf)X≥C kf1kX, where f = (fn)nεZ+ is a uniformly integrable martingale, v = (vn)n2Z+ is a predictable process such that supn |vn|≥1 almost surely, and vf = ((vf) n)nεZ+ denotes the martingale transform of f by v. The main result gives necessary and sufficient conditions on X for this inequality to hold. © Bolyai Institute, University of Szeged.

paper_title.en: ON A RELATION BETWEEN NORMS OF THE MAXIMAL FUNCTION AND THE SQUARE FUNCTION OF A MARTINGALE

description.en: Let Omega be a nonatomic probability space, let X be a Banach function space over Omega, and let M be the collection of all martingales on Omega. For f = (f(n))(n is an element of z+) is an element of M, let Mf and Sf denote the maximal function and the square function of f, respectively. We give some necessary and sufficient conditions for X to have the property that if f, g E is an element of M and parallel to Mg parallel to(x) <= parallel to Mf parallel to(x), then parallel to Sg parallel to(x) <= C parallel to Sf parallel to(x), where C is a constant independent of f and g.

paper_title.en: Uniform boundedness of conditional expectation operators on a Banach function space

description.en: Let X be a Banach function space over a nonatomic probability space. The quasi-Banach space weak-X is defined in a natural way. We give some necessary and sufficient conditions on X for all the conditional expectation operators to be uniformly bounded operators from X into weak-X .

paper_title.en: On some Banach spaces of martingales associated with function spaces

description.en: Let X be a Banach function space over a nonatomic probability space and let F = (F-n) be a filtration. We consider two Banach spaces of martingales K(X, F) and K(X, F) that are associated with X and F. One of our results is a characterization of Banach function spaces X such that K(X, F) = K(X, F) for every filtration F

paper_title.en: ON CERTAIN MARTINGALE INEQUALITIES FOR MAXIMAL FUNCTIONS AND MEAN OSCILLATIONS

description.en: Let X be a Banach function space over a nonatomic probability space. For a uniformly integrable martingale f = (f(n)) with respect to a filtration F = (F(n)), let Mf = sup(n) vertical bar f(n)vertical bar and theta F f = sup(n) E[vertical bar f(infinity) - f(n-1)vertical bar vertical bar F(n)]. We give a necessary and sufficient condition on X for the inequality parallel to theta(F) f parallel to(x) <= C parallel to Mf parallel to(x) to hold.

paper_title.ja: On Doob type inequalities in Banach function spaces
paper_title.en: On Doob type inequalities in Banach function spaces
On some inequalities for Doob decompositions in Banach function spaces

description.en: Let Phi : R -> [0, infinity) be a Young function and let f = (f(n))(n is an element of Z+) be amartingale such that Phi(f(n)) is an element of L(1) for all n is an element of Z(+). Then the process Phi (f) = (Phi(f(n)))(n is an element of Z+) can be uniquely decomposed as Phi(f(n)) = g(n) + h(n), where g = (g(n))(n is an element of Z+) is a martingale and h = (h(n))(n is an element of Z+) is a predictable nondecreasing process such that h(0) = 0 almost surely. The main results characterize those Banach function spaces X such that the inequality parallel to h(infinity)parallel to(X)<= C parallel to Phi(Mf)parallel to(X) is valid, and those X such that the inequality parallel to h(infinity)parallel to(X) <= C parallel to Phi(Sf)parallel to(X) is valid, where M f and S f denote the maximal function and the square function of f, respectively.

paper_title.en: On the Davis inequality in Banach function spaces

description.en: We give a characterization of those Banach function spaces in which the Davis inequality for martingales is valid. (c) 2008 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

paper_title.en: A necessary and sufficient condition for certain martingale inequalities in Banach function spaces

description.en: Let X be a Banach function space over a nonatomic probability space. We investigate certain martingale inequalities in X that generalize those studied by A. M. Garsia. We give necessary and sufficient conditions on X for the inequalities to be valid.

paper_title.en: New martingale inequalities in rearrangement-invariant function spaces

description.en:
We establish various martingale inequalities in a rearrangement-invariant (RI) Banach function space. If X is an RI space that is not too small, we associate with it RI spaces H-P(X) (1 less than or equal to p < infinity) and K(X), and discuss martingale inequalities in these spaces. One of our results is as follows. Let I less than or equal to p < infinity, let f = (f(n)) be an L-P-bounded martingale, and let \f\(P) = g + h be the Doob decomposition of the submartingale \f\(P) = (\f\(P)) into a martingale g = (g(n)) and a predictable non-decreasing process h = (h(n)) with h(0) = 0. Then, in the case where 1 < p < infinity, we obtain the inequalities
\\h(infinity)(1/P)\\ less than or equal to 2\\f(infinity)\\H-P(x) and \\sup(n)\g(n)\(1/P)\\(x) less than or equal to 4\\f(infinity)\\H-P(x), and, in the case where p = 1, we obtain the inequalities
[GRAPHICS]
For some specific choices of X, we can give explicit expressions for H-P(X) and K(X). For example, H-1(L-1) = Llog L, H-P(Lp,infinity) = L-P,L-1, and soon. Furthermore, if the Boyd indicesof X satisfy 0 < alpha(x) less than or equal to betax < 1/P (respectively, 0 < alpha(x)), then H-P(X) = X (respectively, K(X) = X). In any case, 'Hp(X) is embedded in K(X), and K(X) is embedded in X.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE EDINBURGH MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY

paper_title.en: A characterization of Banach function spaces associated with martingales

description.en: Let (Omega, Sigma, P) be a nonatomic probability space and let F= (F-n)(nis an element ofZ+) be a filtration. If f = (f(n))(nis an element ofZ+) is a uniformly integrable F-martingale, let A(F)f = denote the martingale defined byA(F)f(n) = E[\finfinity\] (nis an element ofZ(+)), where finfinity = lim(n)f(n) a.s. Let X be a Banach function space over Omega. We give a necessary and sufficient condition for X to have the property that S(f) is an element of X if and only if S(A(F)f) is an element of X, where S(f) stands for the square function of f = (f(n)). 2000 Mathematical Subject Classification.

paper_title.en: A classification of martingale Hardy spaces associated with rearrangement-invariant function spaces

description.en: Let X be a rearrangement-invariant Banach function space over a complete probability space (Omega, Sigma, P), and denote by H(X, (F-n)) the Hardy space consisting of all martingales f = (f(n), T-n)(n greater than or equal to 0) such that sup\f(n)\ is an element of X. We prove that f = (f(n), F-n) is an element of H(X, (F-n)) implies Af = Af(n), F-n) is an element of H(X, (F-n)) for any filtration F = (F-n) if and only if Doob's inequality holds in X, where Af = (Af(n), F-n) denotes the martingale defined by Af(n) = E [\f(infinity)\\F-n], n = 0, 1, 2, . . . , and f(infinity) = lim(n--> infinity) f(n) a.s.

paper_title.en: On some inequalities for Doob decompositions in Banach function spaces

description.en: Let Φ: ℝ→ [0,∞) be a Young function and let f=(fn)n∈ℤ+ be a martingale such that Φ(fn)∈L1 for all n∈ℤ+. Then the process Φ(f)=(Φ(fn))n∈ℤ+ can be uniquely decomposed as Φ(fn)=gn+hn, where g = (gn)n∈ℤ+ is a martingale and h = (hn)n∈ℤ+ is a predictable nondecreasing process such that h0 = 0 almost surely. The main results characterize those Banach function spaces X such that the inequality {pipe}h∞{pipe}X≤C{pipe}Φ(Mf){pipe}X is valid, and those X such that the inequality {pipe}hX{pipe}X≤C{pipe}Φ(Sf){pipe}X is valid, where Mf and Sf denote the maximal function and the square function of f, respectively. © 2009 Springer-Verlag.

description.en: Let X be a Banach function space over a nonatomic probability space. We investigate certain martingale inequalities in X that generalize those studied by A. M. Garsia. We give necessary and sufficient conditions on X for the inequalities to be valid. © 2007 Glasgow Mathematical Journal Trust.

paper_title.en: New martingale inequalities in rearrangement-invariant function spaces

description.en:
We establish various martingale inequalities in a rearrangement-invariant (RI) Banach function space. If X is an RI space that is not too small, we associate with it RI spaces Hp(X) (1 ≤ p &lt
 ∞) and K(X), and discuss martingale inequalities in these spaces. One of our results is as follows. Let 1 ≤ p &lt
 ∞, let f = (fn) be an L p-bounded martingale, and let |f|p = g + h be the Doob decomposition of the submartingale |f|p = (|fn| p) into a martingale g = (gn) and a predictable non-decreasing process h = (hn) with h0 = 0. Then, in the case where 1 &lt
 p &lt
 ∞, we obtain the inequalities ||h ∞ 1/p||X ≤ 2||f ∞||Hp(X) and ||supn|gn| 1/p||X ≤ 4||f∞||Hp(X) and, in the case where p = 1, we obtain the inequalities ||h∞|| X ≤ supnεℤ+||fn||K(X) and supnεℤ+ ||gn||X ≤ 2 sup nεℤ+ ||fn||K(X). For some specific choices of X, we can give explicit expressions for Hp(X) and K(X). For example, H1(L1) = L log L, Hp(L p,∞) = Lp,1, and so on. Furthermore, ifthe Boyd indices of X satisfy 0 &lt
 αX ≤ βX &lt
 1/p (respectively, 0 &lt
 αX), then Hp(X) 1 (respectively, K(X) = X). In any case, Hp(X) is embedded in K(X), and K(X) is embedded in X.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society

paper_title.en: A characterization of Banach function spaces associated with martingales

description.en: Let (Ω, Σ, ℙ) be a nonatomic probability space and let f = (fn)n∈ℤ+ be a filtration. If f = (f n)n∈ℤ+ is a uniformly integrable F-martingale, let AFf = (AFfn)n∈ℤ+ denote the martingale defined by AFfn = double-struck E sign[|f∞||Fn] (n ∈ ℤ+), where f∞ = limnfn a.s. Let X be a Banach function space over Ω. We give a necessary and sufficient condition for X to have the property that S(f) ∈ X if and only if S(AFf) ∈ X, where S(f) stands for the square function of f = (fn).

paper_title.en: A classification of martingale Hardy spaces associated with rearrangement-invariant function spaces

description.en: Let X be a rearrangement-invariant Banach function space over a complete probability space (Ω, ∑, ℙ), and denote by ℍ(X, (F n)) the Hardy space consisting of all martingales f = (f n, script F sign n)n≧0 such that sup |f n| ∈X. We prove that f = (fn, Fn) ∈ ℍ(X, (script F signn)) implies n≧0 Af = (Af n, script F signn) ∈ ℍ(X, (script F sign n)) for any filtration script F sign = (script F signn) if and only if Doob's inequality holds in X, where script A signf = (script A signfn, script F signn) denotes the martingale defined by script A signfn = E[|f∞||script F signn], n = 0, 1, 2..., and f∞ = limn→∞ fn a.s.

paper_title.en: Characterization of Banach function spaces that preserve the Burkholder square- function inequality
On weighted weak type maximal inequalities for martingales

description.en:
Let Phi be a Young function and (u, v) a pair of weights on a probability space. We consider the inequality
sup Phi(lambda) E[ u :{Mf > lambda}] less than or equal to E[Phi (C\.f(infinity)\) v] lambda is an element of (0,infinity) for martingales f = (f(n))(nis an element ofZ+) , where Mf = sup(nis an element ofZ+) \fn\ and f(infinity) = lim(n) f(n) a.s. We give some necessary and sufficient conditions for this inequality to hold, and extend Uchiyama's result.

paper_title.en: Convergence of weighted averages of martingales in Banach function spaces

description.en:
Let f = (f(n))(n greater than or equal to 1) be a martingale and (w(n))(n greater than or equal to 1) a sequence of positive numbers such that W-n = Sigma(k-1)(n)w(k) --> infinity. Kazamaki and Tsuchikura proved that f converges in L-P (1 < p < infinity) if and only if the weighted average (sigma(n)(f))(n greater than or equal to 1) of f converges in L-P, where sigma(n)(f) are given by
sigma(n)(f) = 1/W-n (k=1)Sigma(n) w(k)f(k), n = 1, 2, ... .
We shall investigate the convergence of f and sigma(n)(f) in general Banach function spaces X. Our main result can be applied to the case where X is a rearrangement-invariant space, or X is a weighted L-P-space with a weight function satisfying the condition A(p) introduced by Izumisawa and Kazamaki. (C) 2000 Academic Press.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS AND APPLICATIONS

paper_title.en: Boundedness and convergence of martingales in rearrangement-invariant function spaces
Averaging operators and martingale inequalities in rearrangement invariant function spaces

description.en: We shall study some connection between averaging operators and martingale inequalities in rearrangement invariant function spaces. In Section 2 the equivalence between Shimogaki's theorem and some martingale inequalities will be established, and in Section 3 the equivalence between Boyd's theorem and martingale inequalities with change of probability measure will be established.

publication_name.en: CANADIAN MATHEMATICAL BULLETIN-BULLETIN CANADIEN DE MATHEMATIQUES

paper_title.en: Convergence of conditional expectations in Banach function spaces

description.en: We give a necessary and sufficient condition that assures the convergence of conditional expectations in a Banach function space. This extends the result of A. Alonso and F. Brambila-Paz [J. Math. Anal. Appl. 221 (1998), 161-176]. We also consider the convergence of conditional expectations in a weighted L-p-spaces. (C) 1999 Academic Press.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS AND APPLICATIONS

paper_title.en: A note on the convergence of martingales in Banach function spaces
A remark on Doob's inequality in Banach function spaces

paper_title.ja: Linear Functionals on Certain Martingale Hardy Spaces
paper_title.en: Linear functionals on certain martingale Hardy spaces

description.ja: We shall introduce some martingale Hardy spaces associated with Banach function spaces, which are extensions of well-known martingale Hardy spaces H?p, and consider continuous linear functionals on the spaces. Some new duality theorems are established.
description.en: We shall introduce some martingale Hardy spaces associated with Banach function spaces, which are extensions of well-known martingale Hardy spaces H p, and consider continuous linear functionals on the spaces. Some new duality theorems are established.

paper_title.en: A note on the energy inequalities for increasing processes
Improved ratio inequalities for martingales.
The best estimation of a ratio inequality for continuous martingales.

publication_name.en: Seminaire de Probabilites XXIII Lecture Notes in Mathematics 1372, Springer-Verlag.
